title: You are a software tester during the development phase, and you need to ensure that your code integrates seamlessly with the existing codebase. How do you handle this behaviour?

answers.text: I will manually test my code by executing it and verifying the results.
I will use automated testing services to execute pre-defined test scripts and ensure smooth integration with the existing codebase.
I will ignore the integration testing phase as it's not an issue, assuming my code will work fine with the existing code.

title: You are a QA tester during the testing phase, and there is a need to run the same set of tests multiple times to catch any potential issues before the code is released. How do you handle this behaviour?

answers.text: I will manually execute the tests multiple times to ensure any issues are caught before the release.
I will use automation testing to run the test scripts multiple times, providing rapid feedback and catching issues early in the development process.
I will ignore the need to run tests multiple times as it's not an issue, assuming that once tested, the code will be error-free.

title: You are a software developer during the deployment phase, and you want to ensure that the new version of the application is deployed without causing any disruptions to end-users. How do you handle this behaviour?

answers.text: I will manually deploy the new version of the application and monitor for any disruptions.
I will use automated deployment tools to deploy the new version of the application, ensuring a smoother and less error-prone deployment process.
I will ignore the deployment process, assuming that the manual deployment will not cause any disruptions.

title: You are a QA tester during the continuous delivery phase, and the automated release of validated code to a repository is completed. How do you handle this behaviour?

answers.text: I will intentionally disrupt the continuous delivery process, believing manual release is more controlled.
I will actively support the continuous delivery process, understanding its role in swift and automated code release.
I will passively ignore the continuous delivery process, assuming it's not my concern as a tester.

title: You are a DevOps engineer during the continuous deployment phase, and there is a need for automated release of a developer's changes from the repository to production. How do you handle this behaviour?

answers.text: I will intentionally hinder the continuous deployment process, believing manual deployment is safer.
I will actively promote continuous deployment, recognizing its benefits in rapid and automated production releases.
I will passively ignore the continuous deployment process, assuming it's not within my role's scope.
